Caption: Fig. 1. Examples of different node-link visualizations: they show data from animal movement ecology in the form of GPS tracks of two oystercatcher birds (distinguished by red/blue color). The visualizations show zoomed-in views of a large data set. Due to zooming, there are some links for which neither start nor end node are visible; here, the texture (right image) provides an indication of movement direction that is completely missing with the standard arrow rendering (left image).
Fig. 3. Readability of link direction with different types of link visualiza- tion, for a zoomed-in view.
